entry.title: The Weight of Wings
entry.summary:
Author: QueenRumi21

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,212Chapters: 2/16Kudos: 62

Summary: Stiles Stilinski thought turning eighteen would mean college applications, sleepless nights, and maybe finally admitting he had a crush on one very broody Alpha werewolf. He did not expect wings. Overnight, Stiles learns the truth his father has kept hidden his whole life: he isn‚Äôt human. He‚Äôs a Nephilim‚Äîhalf-angel, half-human, dangerously powerful, and growing stronger by the day. With a pair of pure white wings and abilities he can‚Äôt control, Stiles is forced to confront a past he never knew existed‚Ä¶ and a destiny he never asked for. As the pack scrambles to understand what Stiles is becoming, Derek Hale feels something inside him stir‚Äîsomething ancient, instinctive, impossible to ignore. A connection he can‚Äôt explain. A bond he can‚Äôt run from. Secrets unravel. Powers awaken.And the weight of wings is heavier than Stiles ever imagined. Nephilim Stiles. Protective Derek. Pack feels. Slow burn Sterek.Family drama, supernatural lore, found family, and a boy learning what it means to be more than human.

entry.title: Crimson Veil
entry.summary:
Author: GrimReaperlover11

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,915Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 37

Summary: Stiles has lived for centuries, and in that time, he has mastered the art of power exchange. As the clinical, ancient vampire owner and Dom of The Crimson Veil, an exclusive, subterranean club where supernaturals explore their deepest desires, Stiles sees everything, and he controls all. He operates on the certainty that true freedom lies in the choice to relinquish control.His kingdom, however, is lacking a challenge, until Derek Hale walks through the archway.Derek is an Alpha. A powerful werewolf whose every instinct screams command. Yet, beneath the heavy mantle of leadership, Derek is suffocating, desperately yearning for a force strong enough to take the reins and relieve him of his overwhelming burden.Stiles spots the raw, beautiful agony in the Alpha's eyes immediately. He sees the king who aches to drop his crown. Their first encounter is a silent, charged collision of immovable dominance and desperate denial, culminating in Derek‚Äôs explosive, fear-fueled growl, a sound that, to Stiles, is merely a magnificent challenge.This isn't a quick claim; it's a centuries-old predator recognizing his ultimate prey.But will Derek allow himself to be hunted?

entry.title: A Tether in the Dark
entry.summary:
Author: ReadNowSleepLater

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,101Chapters: 31/?Kudos: 187

Summary: Stiles Stilinski never meant to become a myth. After the fall of his pack and the fading of Beacon Hills‚Äô magic, he runs ‚Äì straight into a world older, darker, and far more complicated than he ever imagined. Mystic Falls is supposed to be a quiet place to start over, to ground himself again. Instead, it becomes the center of a storm he didn‚Äôt know was waiting for him. Drawn into the tangled lives of the Mikaelsons, Stiles finds unexpected warmth among immortals who should‚Äôve terrified him ‚Äì and something dangerously close to belonging. Between Elijah‚Äôs steady grace, Kol‚Äôs mischief, Klaus‚Äô possessive charm, and Peter‚Äôs return from the shadows, he starts to build something new: a family stitched together by chaos, magic, and a kind of love that defies logic. But magic never lets go without a fight, and neither do old bonds. When ghosts from his past and creatures from the dark rise to claim him, Stiles has to face what it truly means to be an anchor ‚Äì and what, and who, he‚Äôs willing to tether himself to. Because in the end, even in the dark, someone always reaches back.

entry.title: The Howl of Drowning Depths
entry.summary:
Author: am0rawr

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,346Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 84

Summary: The darkness of a ship‚Äôs hold is not an absence of light ‚Äî it is a substance. Thick, viscous, like black oil seeping through rotting planks and settling into lungs and bones. Derek Hale lies chained in that darkness, his body weakened by wolfsbane, his senses flayed raw by the relentless presence of the sea ‚Äî an element forbidden to werewolves, invasive and maddening. The hunters who captured him bring a new prize aboard. Something pale and wrong.Something with rubies set into its eyes and a cold that reeks of the abyss. They call it a trophy.They call it a thing. For Derek, it becomes a reason to survive. In a filthy cell, between injections of poison and the distorted roar of the ocean pressing in from all sides, a desperate pact is forged between a land-bound alpha and a creature born of the depths. A fragile, wordless alliance shaped by pain, proximity, and the shared instinct to endure. Because the true danger is not the captivity.It is not the hunters. It is what they begin to become when survival demands trust.And it is the impossible secret the ocean has dragged to the surface ‚Äî wrapped in rags, breathing softly, and destined to change everything.
